name: py-modin

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: engine
variants.description: Default distribution engine. All engines are installed and functional as long as dependencies are found at run-time

description: Modin: Make your pandas code run faster by changing one line of code.

dependencies.name: py-dask
dependencies.description: Dask is a flexible parallel computing library for analytics.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-pickle5
dependencies.description:
This package backports all features and APIs added in the pickle module
in Python 3.8.3, including the PEP 574 additions. It should work with
Python 3.5, 3.6 and 3.7.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-psutil
dependencies.description:
psutil is a cross-platform library for retrieving information on running
processes and system utilization (CPU, memory, disks, network) in
Python.

dependencies.name: py-pyarrow
dependencies.description:
A cross-language development platform for in-memory data. This package
contains the Python bindings.

dependencies.name: py-ray
dependencies.description:
Ray provides a simple, universal API for building distributed
applications.

dependencies.name: py-redis
dependencies.description: The Python interface to the Redis key-value store.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
